item.title: Carla add a quote by Mel Brooks
item.description: "Tragedy is when I cut my finger. Comedy is when you fall into an open sewer and die." -- Mel Brooks

item.title: Carla add a quote by Jim Henson
item.description: "There's not a word yet, for old friends who've just met." -- Jim Henson

item.title: Carla add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Substitute 'damn' every time you're inclined to write 'very;' your editor will delete it and the writing will be just as it should be." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Carla add a quote by Charlie Chaplin
item.description: "Failure is unimportant. It takes courage to make a fool of yourself" -- Charlie Chaplin

item.title: Carla add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "And above all, watch with glittering eyes the whole world around you because the greatest secrets are always hidden in the most unlikely places. Those who don't believe in magic will never find it." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Carla add a quote by Joey McIntyre
item.description: "It sounds so corny but it feels so good." -- Joey McIntyre

item.title: Carla add a quote by Arthur Ashe
item.description: "Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can." -- Arthur Ashe

item.title: Carla add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Most people don't realize how important librarians are. I ran across a book recently which suggested that the peace and prosperity of a culture was solely related to how many librarians it contained. Possibly a slight overstatement. But a culture that doesn't value its librarians doesn't value ideas and without ideas, well, where are we?" -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Carla add a quote by Spider Robinson
item.description: "Librarians are the secret masters of the world. They control information. Don't ever piss one off. " -- Spider Robinson

item.title: Carla add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Carla add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The difference between the right word and the almost right word is the difference between lightning and a lightning bug." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Carla add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must stay drunk on writing so reality cannot destroy you." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Carla add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Carla add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Fiction is the truth inside the lie." -- Stephen King

item.title: Carla add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Carla add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Carla add a quote by Jim Henson
item.description: "The most sophisticated people I know - inside they are all children. " -- Jim Henson

item.title: Carla add a quote by Jim Henson
item.description: "When I was young, my ambition was to be one of the people who made a difference in this world. My hope is to leave the world a little better for having been there. " -- Jim Henson

item.title: Carla add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Carla add a quote by Russell T. Davies
item.description:
"Doctor Who: You want weapons? We're in a library. Books are the best weapon in the world. This room's the greatest arsenal we could have. Arm yourself!
(from Tooth and Claw in Season 2)" -- Russell T. Davies

item.title: Carla add a quote by Nora Ephron
item.description: "When I buy a new book, I always read the last page first, that way in case I die before I finish, I know how it ends. That, my friend, is a dark side." -- Nora Ephron
